metadata.name: XBAP Execution From Uncommon Locations Via PresentationHost.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files via PresentationHost.EXE from an uncommon location. These files can be abused to run malicious ".xbap" files any bypass AWL

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\presentationhost.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('presentationhost.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.xbap')) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' c:\\windows\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' c:\\program files'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files via PresentationHost.EXE from an uncommon location. These files can be abused to run malicious ".xbap" files any bypass AWL

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate ".xbap" being executed via "PresentationHost" Reference: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Presentationhost/
